subdomains.name: Euclidean Geometry
subdomains.description: Classical geometry of flat space. Points, lines, angles, triangles, circles, and the axioms that govern them.
subdomains.flavor: The Ancient Realm — Euclid's world, where compass and straightedge rule supreme.

topics.name: Points, Lines & Angles
topics.description: Fundamental building blocks. Parallel lines, perpendicular lines, angle relationships, transversals.
topics.flavor: The simplest objects — yet all of geometry springs from them.

topics.name: Triangles
topics.description: Three-sided polygons. Congruence (SSS, SAS, ASA), similarity, area, special triangles.
topics.flavor: The strongest shape in nature — and the most studied in mathematics.

topics.name: Circles
topics.description: Perfect curves of constant radius. Arcs, chords, tangent lines, inscribed angles, π.
topics.flavor: The perfect form — a single curve that captivated mathematicians for millennia.

topics.name: Geometric Constructions
topics.description: Building geometric figures with only compass and straightedge. Classical problems and impossibilities.
topics.flavor: Can you square the circle? The ancients tried — and discovered the limits of their tools.

subdomains.name: Trigonometry
subdomains.description: The mathematics of triangles and periodic functions. Sine, cosine, tangent, and their applications.
subdomains.flavor: The Bridge of Waves — connecting geometry to the rhythms of the universe.

topics.name: Trigonometric Ratios
topics.description: Sin, cos, tan as ratios in right triangles. SOH-CAH-TOA. Inverse trig functions.
topics.flavor: Three ratios that unlock the secrets of every triangle.

topics.name: Unit Circle
topics.description: Trig functions defined on the unit circle. Radians, reference angles, periodicity.
topics.flavor: A single circle that contains all of trigonometry.

topics.name: Trigonometric Identities
topics.description: Pythagorean identities, sum/difference formulas, double-angle, half-angle formulas.
topics.flavor: The hidden equations connecting trig functions — a puzzle of algebraic beauty.

topics.name: Applications of Trigonometry
topics.description: Law of sines, law of cosines, solving oblique triangles, navigation, wave modeling.
topics.flavor: From GPS to music — trig is everywhere in the real world.

subdomains.name: Analytic Geometry
subdomains.description: Geometry through coordinates and equations. The fusion of algebra and geometry by Descartes.
subdomains.flavor: The Cartesian Grid — where algebra and geometry became one.

topics.name: Coordinate Systems
topics.description: Cartesian, polar, parametric coordinates. Plotting points and curves in different systems.
topics.flavor: Different lenses to view the same geometric truth.

topics.name: Conic Sections
topics.description: Circles, ellipses, parabolas, hyperbolas — the curves from slicing a cone.
topics.flavor: Slice a cone and discover the orbits of planets.

topics.name: Vectors in 2D & 3D
topics.description: Geometric vectors, operations, equations of lines and planes in space.

subdomains.name: Differential Geometry
subdomains.description: Geometry using calculus. Curvature of curves and surfaces, manifolds, Riemannian geometry.
subdomains.flavor: The Curved Cosmos — where spacetime bends and straight lines are just an approximation.

topics.name: Curves in Space
topics.description: Parametric curves, arc length, curvature, torsion, Frenet-Serret formulas.
topics.flavor: How much does a curve curve? And in which direction?

topics.name: Surfaces
topics.description: Parametric surfaces, first and second fundamental forms, Gaussian curvature, geodesics.
topics.flavor: The fabric of space itself — curved, stretched, and full of hidden geometry.
